name: Avoid calling system function (CALL 'cfunc')
description: This rule searches for ABAP elements that contain calls to system functions.
output:
Associated to each ABAP artifact in violation, the Quality Rule provides: 
- The number of calls to system functions
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in source code: 
  - CALL 'cfunc'
rationale: As mentioned by SAP, this statement is intended for SAP internal usage only and must not be used in custom code.
sample:
FORM MY-FORM. 
     CALL 'SYSTEM' ID 'COMMAND' FIELD command 
              ID 'TAB' FIELD tabl-*sys*. 
ENDFORM.

technicalCriteria.name: OWASP-2013-A9 Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
OWASP-2017-A9 Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

qualityStandards.name: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
qualityStandards.description: The program invokes a potentially dangerous function that could introduce a vulnerability if it is used incorrectly, but the function can also be used safely.

qualityStandards.name: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
qualityStandards.description: Components, such as libraries, frameworks, and other software modules, almost always run with full privileges. If a vulnerable component is exploited, such an attack can facilitate serious data loss or server takeover. Applications using components with known vulnerabilities may undermine application defenses and enable a range of possible attacks and impacts.

qualityStandards.name: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
qualityStandards.description: Components, such as libraries, frameworks, and other software modules, run with the same privileges as the application. If a vulnerable component is exploited, such an attack can facilitate serious data loss or server takeover. Applications and APIs using components with known vulnerabilities may undermine application defenses and enable various attacks and impacts.
